verses.verse: (Ps. 103:1) While I live I will praise the LORD; I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.
(Ps. 104:33) Do not put your trust in princes, Nor in a son of man, in whom there is no help.
((Is. 2:22)) His spirit departs, he returns to his earth; In that very day ((Eccl. 12:7)) his plans perish.
((Ps. 33:10; 1 Cor. 2:6)) Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, Whose hope is in the LORD his God,
(Jer. 17:7) Who made heaven and earth, The sea, and all that is in them; Who keeps truth forever,
(Gen. 1:1; Ex. 20:11; Acts 4:24; Rev. 14:7) Who executes justice for the oppressed, (Ps. 103:6) Who gives food to the hungry. (Ps. 107:9) The LORD gives freedom to the prisoners.
(Ps. 107:10; Is. 61:1) The LORD opens the eyes of the blind; (Matt. 9:30; (John 9:7, 32, 33)) The LORD raises those who are bowed down; The LORD loves the righteous.
(Luke 13:13) The LORD watches over the strangers; He relieves the fatherless and widow; (Deut. 10:18; Ps. 68:5) But the way of the wicked He turns upside down.
(Ps. 147:6) The LORD shall reign foreverâ€” Your God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise the LORD!

Praise to God for His Word and Providence Praise the LORD! For (Ex. 15:18; Ps. 10:16; (Rev. 11:15)) it is good to sing praises to our God; (Ps. 92:1) For it is pleasant, and (Ps. 135:3) praise is beautiful.
The LORD (Ps. 33:1) builds up Jerusalem; (Ps. 102:16) He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
(Deut. 30:3; Is. 11:12; 56:8; Ezek. 39:28) He heals the brokenhearted And binds up their wounds.
((Ps. 51:17); Is. 61:1; Luke 4:18) He counts the number of the stars; He calls them all by name.
(Is. 40:26) Great is our Lord, and (Ps. 48:1) mighty in power; (Nah. 1:3) His understanding is infinite.
(Is. 40:28) The LORD lifts up the humble; He casts the wicked down to the ground.
Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; Sing praises on the harp to our God,
(Ps. 146:8, 9) Who covers the heavens with clouds, Who prepares rain for the earth, Who makes grass to grow on the mountains.
(Job 38:26; Ps. 104:13) He gives to the beast its food, And (Job 38:41) to the young ravens that cry.
((Matt. 6:26)) He does not delight in the strength of the horse; He takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.
The LORD takes pleasure in those who fear Him, In those who hope in His mercy.
